data.title: Babyface Net Worth 2024: How Much Money Does He Make?
data.meta_description: Wondering how much is Babyface's net worth in 2024? Here are all the details of his career earnings and primary sources of income.
data.meta_site_name: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
data.text:
Curious about Babyface‘s net worth? We have the answers right here. Kenneth Brian Edmonds, known by his stage name Babyface, is one of the most prominent musicians in the world. He has produced a list of songs across genres, which broke all label records. However, his die-hard fans are keen to know about his net worth and his lavish lifestyle. So, here is everything you need to know about the sources of his massive earnings.

What is Babyface’s net worth in 2024?

Babyface has an estimated net worth of $200 Million.

Babyface started his career in the group Manchild in the 70s and went on to form the urban funk group called the Delle in the early 80s. However, he rose to stardom in the production of R&B classics along with Antonio ”L. A” Reid, his Deele partner. The duo collaborated in radio hit productions like Rock Steady by The Whispers and Bobby Brown’s Every Little Step. His own songs, Wonderful Tonight and Every Time I Close My Eyes, gained massive popularity. The singer, writer, and producer has won a total of 12 Grammy awards in his career to date.

Babyface earnings explained — how does he make money?

Babyface’s income sources from his music records and concerts. He has produced a series of successful albums and performed at several concerts, which has contributed to his amassing fortune.

Music

The foundation of LaFace Records has played a significant role in Babyface’s amassing fortune. The 1989 album Tender Lover topped the U.S R& B chart. The first two songs were written by him for Tini Braxton, like the 1993 Toni Braxton and Secrets in 1996. He had helped TLC sell more than 75 million albums, and the second album, CrazySexyCool, went on to become the best-selling album by an American girl group. Apart from this, his other successful albums are triple platinum For the Cool in You, The Day, Christmas with Babyface, Face 2 Face, and Grown & Sexy.

Concerts

Babyface has also generated significant revenue from his live concerts across cities. He is currently headlining the Pearl Concert Theater at Palm Casino Resort, which will be held over three weekends this year.
